abstract: Dario Franchitti capitalized on Will Power's misfortune to reclaim the IndyCar series lead, but it was Carpenter who stole the spotlight.
snippet: Dario Franchitti capitalized on Will Power's misfortune to reclaim the IndyCar series lead, but it was Carpenter who stole the spotlight.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing

lead_paragraph: His famous wife may call the Bluegrass State home, but Kentucky has not been so welcoming to Dario Franchitti. Entering Sunday's Indy 300 at Kentucky Speedway, the three-time IndyCar champion had not finished higher than fifth at the oval track and had wrecked spectacularly in 2007. While Franchitti did not come away with a victory on Sunday, he did leave with the overall IndyCar series lead.

headline.main: Monday Motorsports: Franchitti Regains IndyCar Lead at Kentucky, While Carpenter Logs First Win
